page.title: 02FARMING IN LISMORE: SHEEP
page.content: Farmers and their wives and families account for over{70}of Lismore's people. They make some hay and silage,grow some oats, some turnips and potatoes, but mainly they have{cattle}and{sheep. { SHEEP: }Lambs are sold in August and September.In 1985{3000 lambs}left the island for markets in Oban, Stirling or Perth, where breeding ewe lambs have often topped the sale. This year Â£46,Â£47 and a record for the island of Â£56 was paid for ewe lambs in different sales. { Tups}(rams) are put out in{November, and include{Cross Suffolk, Border {Leicester}and{Bluehead Leicester. { Ewes}include{Blackface, Cheviot, {Cross Suffolk,Swaledale}and one or two {Charolais.}Lambs are mostly expected from{1st April}outside, and average between 120% and 130%. {
